abstract.text: The

class allows users to browse compositions that are in the Quartz Composer composition repository, and to preview them. You can set the default input parameters for a composition preview  by using the method setDefaultValue:forInputKey:.

inlineContent.text: Note that the composition picker view does not automatically refresh its content when the composition repository is updated. Itâ€™s your responsibility to perform any necessary updating.

abstract.text: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.
The
class represents a Quartz Composer composition that either:
A layer that loads, plays, and controls Quartz Composer compositions in a Core Animation layer hierarchy.
A class that allows users to edit the input parameters of a composition in real time. The composition can be rendering in any of the following objects:
, or
The
class represents a utility window that allows users to browse compositions that are in the Quartz Composer composition repository and, if supported, preview the composition. The
class cannot be subclassed.
The

class allows users to browse compositions that are in the Quartz Composer composition repository, and to preview them. You can set the default input parameters for a composition preview  by using the method setDefaultValue:forInputKey:.
Retrieves the empty-selection state of the composition picker view.
Returns the background color of the composition picker view.
Retrieves the aspect ratio used to display compositions in the composition picker  view.
Returns the list of compositions that are currently in the composition picker view.
Retrieves the composition picker view delegate.
Returns whether the composition picker view draws its background.
Returns whether or not the composition picker view is currently animating its composition.
Retrieves the maximum frame rate for animating compositions.
Retrieves the number of columns in the composition picker view.
Retrieves the number of rows in the composition picker view.
Clears all previously set default values for composition input parameters.
Returns the composition that is currently selected in the composition picker view.
Sets whether to allow an empty selection in the composition picker view.
Sets the background color for the composition picker view.
Sets  the aspect ratio used to display compositions in the composition picker view.
Sets the  compositions in the composition picker view  to those that match the specified criteria.
Sets the default value to use for a composition input parameter.
Sets the composition picker view delegate.
Sets whether the composition picker view draws its background.
Sets the maximum frame rate for animating compositions.
Sets the number of columns in the composition picker view.
Sets the number of rows in the composition picker view.
Sets a composition as selected in the composition picker view.
Enables  the display of composition names in the composition picker view.
Retrieves whether composition names can be shown in the composition picker view.
Starts animating the composition in the composition picker view.
Stops animating the composition that is currently animating in the composition picker view.
Posted when the user selects a composition in the picker view.
The
class represents a system-wide centralized repository of built-in and installed Quartz Composer compositions (
and
). The
class cannot be subclassed.
A base class to subclass for writing custom patches.
The

class communicates (through Cocoa bindings) between a custom patch and the view used for the internal settings of the custom patch. Only custom patches that use internal settings exposed to the user need to use the
class.
A base class for low-level rendering.
The
class is a custom
class that loads, plays, and controls Quartz Composer compositions. It is an autonomous view that is driven by an internal timer running on the main thread.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A set of methods that the destination object (or recipient) of a dragged image must implement.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
